title: W3.CSSColors

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSSColors with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
W3.CSS Default Color Classes
The default color class used in W3.CSS is inspired by Material Design.
Material Design colors reflect the colors used in marketing, road signs, and sticky notes.
The following W3.CSS color classes can be used on any HTML element:
w3-red
w3-pink
w3-purple
w3-deep-purple
w3-indigo
w3-cobalt
w3-blue
w3-light-blue
w3-cyan
w3-aqua
w3-teal
w3-green
w3-light-green
w3-lime
w3-sand
w3-khaki
w3-yellow
w3-amber
w3-orange
w3-deep-orange
w3-blue-gray
w3-brown
w3-light-gray
w3-gray
w3-dark-gray
w3-asphalt
w3-black
w3-pale-red
w3-pale-yellow
w3-pale-green
w3-pale-blue

Hover Color Classes
The following W3.CSS hover color classes can be used on any HTML element:
w3-hover-red
w3-hover-pink
w3-hover-purple
w3-hover-deep-purple

quiz.question: What is CSS?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of CSS is 'inspired by Material Design'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSSColors concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSSColors effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSSColors and how to apply it in your projects.
